intro: Phoradendron apurense, commonly known as the Apurean mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. Phoradendron apurense plays a role in ecological systems by supporting biodiversity through its interactions with host trees and animals.
